page.title: 09CROPS: WARLEY, ESSEX
page.content: Cropping patterns reflect the high prices paid to farmers for{cereal} growing by the Common Agricultural Policy of the EEC. The{London Clay}is a relatively difficult soil to work and one would expect it to support mostly grazing. About{8000 ha.}of the block are on{London Clay,}but with high cereal prices a survey in May showed that about{40%}of this is now put down to{barley}and{wheat (c.1800 {ha.}and{1150 ha.}respectively). App_ roximately{370 ha.}of{oil seed rape} was also noted in the block. In contrast there is little arable on the {Upper Tertiary}and{Pleistocene}Beds: woodland predominates here, and other farmland is mostly{pasture.}Horses and riding stables are not uncommon here, paddocks having a rather unkempt appearance.
